education.title: Computer Science — NTNU
education.description: A 5 years integrated master's degree at the Norwegian University of Science and Technology. I'm specializing in database systems, search engines and AI. I will finish the degree in spring 2022.

itCompanies.name: Capgemini
itCompanies.description: For the last internship during my studies I wanted to experience the world of consultants. I worked, in cooperation with my team, on the development of a digital information center for Forsvarsbygg. The purpose of the project was to improve experience for the tenants of Forsvarsbygg and reduce the number of inquiries to their service center. From the work certificate I received: "Throughout the project Martin has shown to be proficient in the programming languages and frameworks used. The solution delivered by the students provides an excellent foundation for the product that may soon be implemented."

itCompanies.name: Strise
itCompanies.description: This was my first "real" internship and I worked as a front-end developer. Strise aims to revolutionize enterprise software, and I could not have found a better place to start my IT career. I worked part time alongside my studies until May, and then continued as an intern during summer. My tasks naturally included a lot of bug squashing and refactoring, but also implementing new features and creating internal tools for efficiency. An example is making a Slack bot to add previews for links to the Strise products. You can read about that and more in a blogpost I wrote for Strise at the link below.

itCompanies.name: NTNU
itCompanies.description: I was a student assistant in the course TDT4145: Data Modelling and Database Systems. It was a great joy helping other students professionally. I often ended up spending more time than I was paid for, just for the fun of it.

otherCompanies.name: NTNU
otherCompanies.description: I was a mentor for a student with a functional disability in the courses "TMA4145 - Discrete Mathematics", "TDT4113 - Programming Project" and "TIØ4252 - Technology Management".

otherCompanies.name: Foodora
otherCompanies.description: I worked as a food delivery cyclist, aka "rider". Exercising while making money made this a good part time job alongside the studies.

otherCompanies.name: Me
otherCompanies.description: I worked part time as a bartender and it was a really fun experiece. And besides, being good at making drinks is a "surprisingly" useful skill.

otherCompanies.name: Norwegian Army
otherCompanies.description: I was in the Norwegian Air Defence Battalion for one year, honing both self discipline and communication skills.
